statement.tex: %text Using properties of determinants, solve the following for $x$: % \left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} x-2 & 2x-3 & 3x-4 \\ x-4 & 2x-9 & 3x-16 \\ x-8 & 2x-27 & 3x-64 \end{array}\right\vert=0

step.context: \left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} x-2 & 2x-3 & 3x-4 \\ x-4 & 2x-9 & 3x-16 \\ x-8 & 2x-27 & 3x-64 \end{array}\right\vert \\ %text To reduce the above determinant, what is a preferred set of transforms? %
step.tex: R_2\rightarrow R_2-R_1,\, R_2\rightarrow -\dfrac{1}{2}R_2 \\ R_3\rightarrow R_3-R_1,\, R_3\rightarrow -\dfrac{1}{6}R_3 \\
R_2\rightarrow R_2+R_1,\, R_2\rightarrow -\dfrac{1}{2}R_2 \\ R_3\rightarrow R_3+R_1,\, R_3\rightarrow -\dfrac{1}{2}R_3
step.reason: R_2\rightarrow R_2-R_1 \\ R_3\rightarrow R_3-R_1 \\ %text is the preferred set of transforms since it results in single values in rows $2$ and $3$ instead of mixed values (see determinant). % D=\left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} x-2 & 2x-3 & 3x-4 \\ {\bf -2} & {\bf -6} & {\bf -12} \\ {\bf -6} & {\bf -24} & {\bf -60} \end{array}\right\vert \\ %text Further by dividing $R_2$ by $-2$ and $R_3$ by $-6$ we get, % \quad=12\left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} x-2 & 2x-3 & 3x-4 \\ 1 & 3 & 6 \\ 1 & 4 & 10 \end{array}\right\vert \\

\left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} x-2 & 2x-3 & 3x-4 \\ 1 & 3 & 6 \\ 1 & 4 & 10 \end{array}\right\vert \\ {\bf C_2\rightarrow C_2-3C_1} \\ \left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} x-2 & -x+3 & 3x-4 \\ 1 & 0 & 6 \\ 1 & 1 & 10 \end{array}\right\vert \\ {\bf C_3\rightarrow C_3-4C_1} \\ \left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} x-2 & -x+3 & 8-3x \\ 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 1 & 1 & 4 \end{array}\right\vert
